words.defineEn: lacking seriousness and respect on a serious matter in an attempt to appear humorous or clever

words.defineEn: large Indian stork with a military gait
words.defineVi: con cò lớn của Ấn Độ với dáng đi quân sự

examples: And the problem is, as they all point out, with this particular threat, you have to be almost clairvoyant, because, by the time you see the illness, you're way behind the disease.
words.defineEn: perceiving things beyond the natural range of the senses
words.defineVi: nhận thức những thứ vượt ra ngoài phạm vi tự nhiên của các giác quan

examples: I imagine that he believed that the once-all-powerful Kremlin had far fewer resources and far less power over recalcitrant provinces and institutions of government than he thought when he came into the Kremlin as a newcomer after all.

words.defineEn: marked by stubborn resistance to authority
words.defineVi: được đánh dấu bằng sự phản kháng ngoan cố đối với chính quyền

words.defineEn: conspicuously and outrageously bad or reprehensible
words.defineVi: rõ ràng và cực kỳ tồi tệ hoặc đáng trách

examples: You would probably be negatively buoyant inside here.
A buoyant object will always be pushed up the liquid to the highest point on a meniscus.
A buoyant object will always repel something held up by surface tension’s stretchy membrane.
They’re naturally negatively buoyant, meaning they sink in water.
Would you believe that reindeer are buoyant?
words.defineEn: being optimistic and behaving in a cheerful manner
words.defineVi: lạc quan và cư xử một cách vui vẻ

examples: The flamboyant businessman is still sitting pretty.
One of the most fascinating things about bearded dragons is their flamboyant non-verbal communication.
MALCOLM BRABANT: Britain's most flamboyant Druid, King Arthur Pendragon, is on the warpath.
MALCOLM BRABANT: Britain's most flamboyant Druid, King Arthur Pendragon, is on the warpath.
But in many places, scientists are seeing something else: colorful corals, in flamboyant greens, reds, pinks, and purples.
words.defineVi: trang trí công phu hoặc quá mức

examples: Well, some plants go dormant.
The virus can lay dormant for days or weeks
Nearly three months ago, a dormant conflict on the fringes of Europe broke into brutal warfare.
Nearly three months ago, a dormant conflict on the fringes of Europe broke into brutal warfare.
If it goes below that, they go dormant.
words.defineEn: in a condition of biological rest or suspended animation
words.defineVi: trong điều kiện nghỉ ngơi sinh học hoặc hoạt hình bị đình chỉ

examples: The energy company's board of directors was composed entirely of men in gray suits who were resistant to investing in renewable energy sources.
The board of directors of the company was composed entirely of men in gray suits who were resistant to change and innovation, and who were not receptive to new ideas or perspectives.
She had been resistant to new technology, but times change and we with time - she had to learn how to use the latest devices.
These mongooses are resistant to neurotoxins in snake venom.
Antibiotic resistant bacteria are here.
words.defineEn: being protected from or having a high degree of resistance to something, such as an infection or disease

từ chối phục tùng chính quyền

examples: Well, basically, many Black farmers experienced blatant discrimination at the United States Department of Agriculture.
It can be blatant and right up in your face.
What I heard was a blatant attack on our democracy.

- These have got ta be one of the most blatant rip-offs of the AirPods Pro that I have ever seen.
words.defineEn: conspicuously and offensively loud; given to vehement outcry
words.defineVi: lớn tiếng một cách dễ thấy và xúc phạm; phản đối kịch liệt

examples: She searched through the old documents to find the relevant information.

Please contact me at your earliest convenience so that we may exchange any relevant information.

- None of them are relevant.
words.defineEn: having a close connection with the situation or subject at hand

thực thi quyền lực hoặc thẩm quyền

examples: That's kinda redundant with the last one.

words.defineEn: surpassing what is needed or required, and so, no longer of use

examples: It's so poignant.

words.defineEn: keenly distressing to the mind or feelings
words.defineVi: đau khổ sâu sắc cho tâm trí hoặc cảm xúc

examples: But Murphy remains adamant.

But the president is still adamant that he understands the way that this should work and the way it's going to work.
words.defineEn: impervious to pleas, persuasion, requests, reason
words.defineVi: không thấm vào lời cầu xin, thuyết phục, yêu cầu, lý do
